name: Holographic Associative Memory (HAM)
description: The Swarm can store multiple spatial patterns in its distributed coupling matrix using Hebbian learning principles. It acts as a content-addressable memory, recalling the full pattern from a partial or noisy cue via collective phase synchronization.
hypothesis: If the coupling matrix is structured via the Hebbian rule $J_{ij} \propto \sum \xi_i \xi_j$, the swarm's phase dynamics will possess attractors corresponding to the stored patterns $\xi$.
implications: The Pilot has 'Long-Term Memory' stored in the relationships between agents.
Memory is holographic: distributed across the entire swarm, robust to agent loss.
Recall is an emergent property of collective dynamics, not a database lookup.
